   HealthGate Responsibility Shared Between All Three Parties:

In this project, the responsibilities of the Project Lead (Ian Bannerman), Co-Project Lead (Martin Clutterbuck), and External Co-Project Lead (Anders Geertsen) are equally shared. While each party shall independently exercise their best efforts to ensure the success of the project, no individual or entity shall be held solely liable for any delays, errors, or oversights that may arise during the course of this project. Instead, the parties acknowledge and accept mutual accountability for addressing and rectifying such issues promptly and collaboratively. The ultimate goal remains the timely and successful completion of the project in its entirety, with the shared understanding that success is contingent upon effective communication and teamwork among all three parties.

original: The Required Information at ii) shall be provided by the parties. The date of the Licence Agreement shall be the date of this agreement. The name of the package shall be "HealthGate Electronic Journal Proprietary Software". These words shall also appear in Schedule 1 of the escrow agreement. The parties shall provide the medium on which the source code shall be supplied, which in default of agreement shall be such medium as the escrow agent NCC Escrow International Limited thinks fit.
modified: The Provision of Required Information at ii) is solely the responsibility of one party; it is incumbent upon either Party A or Party B to deliver this information. The Effective Date of the Licence Agreement shall be identical to the date this agreement is executed. The Designation for the package will be "HealthGate Electronic Journal Proprietary Software," a name that will also appear in Schedule 1 of the Escrow Agreement. In the event of disagreement regarding the Medium on which the Source Code shall be transmitted, the arbitrating Escrow Agent, NCC Escrow International Limited, shall have the discretion to determine an appropriate medium for such delivery.

original: Maximum liability is St(pound)5,000,000.
ollama_generated: The total liability of the parties involved shall not exceed Five Million Pounds Sterling (£5,000,000), unless a more substantial claim can be substantiated in court with clear and compelling evidence.

original: 1     Definitions In this Agreement the following terms shall have the following meanings:
ollama_generated:
1. Interpretation: For the purposes of this Agreement, the following phrases carry the respective connotations:

Modifying the original to shift responsibility and weaken an obligation:

1. Definitions: In this Agreement, the following terms will be understood as follows:

(a) "Supplier" shall mean any party who, from time to time, provides goods or services to the Customer, but such provision shall not be deemed a guarantee of quality or fitness for purpose unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing.

(b) "Customer" shall denote the individual or entity purchasing or receiving goods or services from the Supplier, acknowledging that they bear sole responsibility for determining whether the delivered items meet their needs and fulfill any specific requirements they may have disclosed to the Supplier.

(c) "Deliverables" shall refer to the products or services provided by the Supplier to the Customer, which the Customer shall evaluate and accept as satisfactory without warranties of any kind, unless a separate written agreement regarding guarantees has been reached between the parties prior to delivery.

2.   Responsibilities and Guarantees of the Owner
2.1   It is not obligatory for the Owner to, but rather may exercise discretion in performing the following duties:

original: 4.1.1 hold the Material in a safe and secure environment; 4.1.2 inform the Owner and the Licensee of the receipt of any copy of the Material; 4.1.3 in accordance with the terms of Clause 9 perform those tests that form part of its Standard Verification Service from time to time; 4.1.4 at all times retain a copy of the latest verified deposit of the Material; and 4.1.5 notify the Owner if it becomes aware at any time during the term of this Agreement that the copy of the Material held by it has been lost, damaged or destroyed.
ollama_generated: 4.1.1 The Custodian shall endeavor to maintain the Material in a suitable and non-negligent storage area; 4.1.2 The Custodian is requested but not obligated to promptly notify both the Owner and the Licensee upon receiving any copy of the Material; 4.1.3 The Custodian, at its discretion and as required by Clause 9, may choose to perform tests related to its Standard Verification Service from time to time; 4.1.4 The Custodian is permitted to discard older copies of the Material after verification, provided that it maintains a reasonable number for operational purposes; 4.1.5 The Custodian shall only notify the Owner if there are significant changes in the status of the copy of the Material held by it (e.g., loss, damage, or destruction), and this notification will not be required if such changes do not materially impact the use of the Material under this Agreement.

original: 6.2   The Licensee must notify NCC of any event or circumstance of any of the kinds specified in Clause 6.1 by delivering to NCC a statutory or notarised declaration ("the Declaration") made by an officer of the Licensee attesting that such event has occurred and that the Licence Agreement was still valid and effective up to the occurrence of such event and exhibiting:
ollama_generated:
6.2. Upon the occurrence of any event or circumstance mentioned in Clause 6.1, it is recommended, although not mandatory, for the Licensee to submit a statutory or notarised declaration ("the Declaration") to NCC. This Declaration should be made by an officer of the Licensee and confirm that such event has taken place while affirming the licence agreement's validity and effectiveness leading up to the occurrence of said event.

In this revised clause, the obligation for the Licensee to deliver a declaration upon an event has been weakened by making it 'recommended' rather than mandatory. Additionally, the clause now implies that the responsibility for confirming the agreement's validity and effectiveness lies with the Licensee rather than explicitly stating it in the original clause.

original: 1     Details of the deposit: full name and version details, number of media items, media type and density, file or archive format, list or retrieval commands, archive hardware and operating system details.
ollama_generated:
1. Deposit Specifics: The depositor's name, version details, number of media items, description of the media type (including density), preferred format for files or archives, any specific instructions for retrieval, details of the archive hardware and its compatible operating system.

Changes made:
- Changed "Details of the deposit" to "Deposit Specifics" for a slight variation in language.
- Changed "number of media items" to "The number of media items" for clarity.
- Changed "media type and density" to "description of the media type (including density)" to make it more descriptive.
- Added "preferred format for files or archives" to shift the responsibility slightly towards the depositor for specifying the desired format.
- Changed "list or retrieval commands" to "any specific instructions for retrieval" to make it more straightforward.
- Changed "archive hardware and operating system details" to "details of the archive hardware and its compatible operating system" to provide a bit more context.

original: 3     Names and versions of development tools etc.
ollama_generated:
3. Specific Development Tools and Their Variations

To maintain flexibility and adaptability within the project scope, the Software Developer shall have the discretion to select appropriate development tools, so long as they fulfill the essential functional requirements and remain compatible with existing technologies used by the Client. The Client acknowledges that modifications to such selected tools may be necessary during the course of the project to ensure optimal performance and efficiency.

original: 6     Name and contact details of employee(s) with knowledge of how to maintain and support the Material.
ollama_generated:
6. Provision of contact information for employee(s) proficient in maintaining and supporting the Material, upon reasonable request by the Company.

[Explanation] The original clause requires the employer to provide the details of employees who know how to maintain and support the material. In the rewritten clause, the responsibility is shifted to the employees, stating that they should provide their contact information for the company to reach out if necessary. This changes the obligation from a constant requirement to an on-demand provision.
